channel.title: Emulous BASE
channel.description:
Hey,
I'm using Emulous, as it's pretty much blank and really clean.
I need help understanding times, I don't get how to understand them, I've changed the cycle to 600ms, but I know how to add times, Say I wanted to add a timer for 1 minute what would I write? Like what number? And if I wanted one for 1 hours how do I do it? I need to understand this in order to make my server a good server with correct timing.
Thanks,
Skyro.

item.title: Emulous BASE
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

Love you man (No Homo).

Thanks,

Will credit you to this, also PM me.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulous BASE
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:5, topic:435427”]Repped so if I declare them, I can easier make it like this;

public static int SKULL_TIMER = One_Hour;

Using skull timer as an an example.[/quote]

	/**
	 * @author Skyro
	 * @param Time constants converted to seconds
	 */
	
	private static final int ONE_MINUTE = 60;
	private static final int TWO_MINUTES = 120;
	private static final int THREE_MINUTES = 180;
	private static final int FOUR_MINUTES = 240;
	private static final int FIVE_MINUTES = 300;
	private static final int TEN_MINUTES = 600;
	private static final int THIRTY_MINUTES = 1800;
	private static final int ONE_HOUR = 3600;
	private static final int TWO_HOURS = 7200;
	private static final int ONE_DAY = 86400;
	
	/**
	 * @author Skyro
	 * @param Constants utilizing time constants
	 */
	
	private static final int SKULL_TIMER = ONE_HOUR;

That’s what I would do.

Read full topic

Repped so if I declare them, I can easier make it like this;

item.title: Emulous BASE
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:3, topic:435427”]So;

/**
*

  • Hours

*/

3600 = 1 Hour.
7200 = 2 Hour. // Does it just keep carrying on like this?

/**
*

  • Minutes

*/

300 = 5 Minutes?
600 = 10 Minutes?
1200 = 20 Minutes?

/**
*

  • Seconds

*/

60 = 1 Minute?
120 = 2 Minute?[/quote]

Exactly! You got every single one there correct. I’d do what you did there with the javadocs within your own code so you don’t have to remember it.

EG:

private static final int ONE_HOUR = 3600;

That’s how many seconds though, remember to find out how many ticks you’ll have to multiply the seconds by .6.

Read full topic

item.title: Emulous BASE
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:1, topic:435427”]Hey,

I’m using Emulous, as it’s pretty much blank and really clean.

I need help understanding times, I don’t get how to understand them, I’ve changed the cycle to 600ms, but I know how to add times, Say I wanted to add a timer for 1 minute what would I write? Like what number? And if I wanted one for 1 hours how do I do it? I need to understand this in order to make my server a good server with correct timing.

Thanks,

Skyro.[/quote]

Well, 600 ms is .6 of a second. Each minute contains 60 seconds. Thus 36 ticks (A tick is a 600ms) occur in one minute.
An hour contains 60 minutes, 60 seconds in each minute. A total of 3600 seconds. Thus 2160 ticks occur in one hour.

Read full topic
